text: I
text_tokenized: I

text: A very little quiet reflection was enough to satisfy Emma as to the nature of her agitation on hearing this news of Frank Churchill .
text_tokenized: A very little quiet reflection was enough to satisfy Emma as to the nature of her agitation on hearing this news of Frank Churchill .

text: She was soon convinced that it was not for herself she was feeling at all apprehensive or embarrassed ; it was for him . Her own attachment had really subsided into a mere nothing ; it was not worth thinking of;-- but if he , who had undoubtedly been always so much the most in love of the two , were to be returning with the same warmth of sentiment which he had taken away , it would be very distressing .
text_tokenized: She was soon convinced that it was not for herself she was feeling at all apprehensive or embarrassed ; it was for him . Her own attachment had really subsided into a mere nothing ; it was not worth thinking of;-- but if he , who had undoubtedly been always so much the most in love of the two , were to be returning with the same warmth of sentiment which he had taken away , it would be very distressing .

text: If a separation of two months should not have cooled him , there were dangers and evils before her:--caution for him and for herself would be necessary .
text_tokenized: If a separation of two months should not have cooled him , there were dangers and evils before her:--caution for him and for herself would be necessary .

text: She did not mean to have her own affections entangled again , and it would be incumbent on her to avoid any encouragement of his .
text_tokenized: She did not mean to have her own affections entangled again , and it would be incumbent on her to avoid any encouragement of his .

text: She wished she might be able to keep him from an absolute declaration .
text_tokenized: She wished she might be able to keep him from an absolute declaration .

text: That would be so very painful a conclusion of their present acquaintance !
text_tokenized: That would be so very painful a conclusion of their present acquaintance !

text: and yet , she could not help rather anticipating something decisive .
text_tokenized: and yet , she could not help rather anticipating something decisive .

text: She felt as if the spring would not pass without bringing a crisis , an event , a something to alter her present composed and tranquil state .
text_tokenized: She felt as if the spring would not pass without bringing a crisis , an event , a something to alter her present composed and tranquil state .

text: It was not very long , though rather longer than Mr. Weston had foreseen , before she had the power of forming some opinion of Frank Churchill 's feelings .
text_tokenized: It was not very long , though rather longer than Mr. Weston had foreseen , before she had the power of forming some opinion of Frank Churchill 's feelings .

text: The Enscombe family were not in town quite so soon as had been imagined , but he was at Highbury very soon afterwards .
text_tokenized: The Enscombe family were not in town quite so soon as had been imagined , but he was at Highbury very soon afterwards .

text: He rode down for a couple of hours ; he could not yet do more ; but as he came from Randalls immediately to Hartfield , she could then exercise all her quick observation , and speedily determine how he was influenced , and how she must act .
text_tokenized: He rode down for a couple of hours ; he could not yet do more ; but as he came from Randalls immediately to Hartfield , she could then exercise all her quick observation , and speedily determine how he was influenced , and how she must act .

text: They met with the utmost friendliness .
text_tokenized: They met with the utmost friendliness .

text: There could be no doubt of his great pleasure in seeing her .
text_tokenized: There could be no doubt of his great pleasure in seeing her .

text: But she had an almost instant doubt of his caring for her as he had done , of his feeling the same tenderness in the same degree .
text_tokenized: But she had an almost instant doubt of his caring for her as he had done , of his feeling the same tenderness in the same degree .

text: She watched him well .
text_tokenized: She watched him well .

text: It was a clear thing he was less in love than he had been .
text_tokenized: It was a clear thing he was less in love than he had been .

text: Absence , with the conviction probably of her indifference , had produced this very natural and very desirable effect .
text_tokenized: Absence , with the conviction probably of her indifference , had produced this very natural and very desirable effect .

text: He was in high spirits ; as ready to talk and laugh as ever , and seemed delighted to speak of his former visit , and recur to old stories : and he was not without agitation .
text_tokenized: He was in high spirits ; as ready to talk and laugh as ever , and seemed delighted to speak of his former visit , and recur to old stories : and he was not without agitation .

text: It was not in his calmness that she read his comparative difference .
text_tokenized: It was not in his calmness that she read his comparative difference .

text: He was not calm ; his spirits were evidently fluttered ; there was restlessness about him .
text_tokenized: He was not calm ; his spirits were evidently fluttered ; there was restlessness about him .

text: Lively as he was , it seemed a liveliness that did not satisfy himself ; but what decided her belief on the subject , was his staying only a quarter of an hour , and hurrying away to make other calls in Highbury .
text_tokenized: Lively as he was , it seemed a liveliness that did not satisfy himself ; but what decided her belief on the subject , was his staying only a quarter of an hour , and hurrying away to make other calls in Highbury .

text: " He had seen a group of old acquaintance in the street as he passed-- he had not stopped , he would not stop for more than a word -- but he had the vanity to think they would be disappointed if he did not call , and much as he wished to stay longer at Hartfield , he must hurry off . "
text_tokenized: " He had seen a group of old acquaintance in the street as he passed-- he had not stopped , he would not stop for more than a word -- but he had the vanity to think they would be disappointed if he did not call , and much as he wished to stay longer at Hartfield , he must hurry off . "

text: She had no doubt as to his being less in love -- but neither his agitated spirits , nor his hurrying away , seemed like a perfect cure ; and she was rather inclined to think it implied a dread of her returning power , and a discreet resolution of not trusting himself with her long .
text_tokenized: She had no doubt as to his being less in love -- but neither his agitated spirits , nor his hurrying away , seemed like a perfect cure ; and she was rather inclined to think it implied a dread of her returning power , and a discreet resolution of not trusting himself with her long .

text: This was the only visit from Frank Churchill in the course of ten days .
text_tokenized: This was the only visit from Frank Churchill in the course of ten days .

text: He was often hoping , intending to come -- but was always prevented .
text_tokenized: He was often hoping , intending to come -- but was always prevented .

text: His aunt could not bear to have him leave her .
text_tokenized: His aunt could not bear to have him leave her .

text: Such was his own account at Randall 's .
text_tokenized: Such was his own account at Randall 's .

text: If he were quite sincere , if he really tried to come , it was to be inferred that Mrs. Churchill 's removal to London had been of no service to the wilful or nervous part of her disorder .
text_tokenized: If he were quite sincere , if he really tried to come , it was to be inferred that Mrs. Churchill 's removal to London had been of no service to the wilful or nervous part of her disorder .

text: That she was really ill was very certain ; he had declared himself convinced of it , at Randalls . Though much might be fancy , he could not doubt , when he looked back , that she was in a weaker state of health than she had been half a year ago . He did not believe it to proceed from any thing that care and medicine might not remove , or at least that she might not have many years of existence before her ; but he could not be prevailed on , by all his father 's doubts , to say that her complaints were merely imaginary , or that she was as strong as ever .
text_tokenized: That she was really ill was very certain ; he had declared himself convinced of it , at Randalls . Though much might be fancy , he could not doubt , when he looked back , that she was in a weaker state of health than she had been half a year ago . He did not believe it to proceed from any thing that care and medicine might not remove , or at least that she might not have many years of existence before her ; but he could not be prevailed on , by all his father 's doubts , to say that her complaints were merely imaginary , or that she was as strong as ever .

text: It soon appeared that London was not the place for her .
text_tokenized: It soon appeared that London was not the place for her .

text: She could not endure its noise .
text_tokenized: She could not endure its noise .

text: Her nerves were under continual irritation and suffering ; and by the ten days ' end , her nephew 's letter to Randalls communicated a change of plan .
text_tokenized: Her nerves were under continual irritation and suffering ; and by the ten days ' end , her nephew 's letter to Randalls communicated a change of plan .

text: They were going to remove immediately to Richmond .
text_tokenized: They were going to remove immediately to Richmond .

text: Mrs. Churchill had been recommended to the medical skill of an eminent person there , and had otherwise a fancy for the place .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Churchill had been recommended to the medical skill of an eminent person there , and had otherwise a fancy for the place .

text: A ready - furnished house in a favourite spot was engaged , and much benefit expected from the change .
text_tokenized: A ready - furnished house in a favourite spot was engaged , and much benefit expected from the change .

text: Emma heard that Frank wrote in the highest spirits of this arrangement , and seemed most fully to appreciate the blessing of having two months before him of such near neighbourhood to many dear friends-- for the house was taken for May and June . She was told that now he wrote with the greatest confidence of being often with them , almost as often as he could even wish . Emma saw how Mr. Weston understood these joyous prospects .
text_tokenized: Emma heard that Frank wrote in the highest spirits of this arrangement , and seemed most fully to appreciate the blessing of having two months before him of such near neighbourhood to many dear friends-- for the house was taken for May and June . She was told that now he wrote with the greatest confidence of being often with them , almost as often as he could even wish . Emma saw how Mr. Weston understood these joyous prospects .

text: He was considering her as the source of all the happiness they offered .
text_tokenized: He was considering her as the source of all the happiness they offered .

text: She hoped it was not so . Two months must bring it to the proof . Mr. Weston 's own happiness was indisputable .
text_tokenized: She hoped it was not so . Two months must bring it to the proof . Mr. Weston 's own happiness was indisputable .

text: He was quite delighted .
text_tokenized: He was quite delighted .

text: It was the very circumstance he could have wished for .
text_tokenized: It was the very circumstance he could have wished for .

text: Now , it would be really having Frank in their neighbourhood .
text_tokenized: Now , it would be really having Frank in their neighbourhood .

text: What were nine miles to a young man?--An hour 's ride .
text_tokenized: What were nine miles to a young man?--An hour 's ride .

text: He would be always coming over .
text_tokenized: He would be always coming over .

text: The difference in that respect of Richmond and London was enough to make the whole difference of seeing him always and seeing him never .
text_tokenized: The difference in that respect of Richmond and London was enough to make the whole difference of seeing him always and seeing him never .

text: Sixteen miles -- nay , eighteen -- it must be full eighteen to Manchester - street -- was a serious obstacle . Were he ever able to get away , the day would be spent in coming and returning .
text_tokenized: Sixteen miles -- nay , eighteen -- it must be full eighteen to Manchester - street -- was a serious obstacle . Were he ever able to get away , the day would be spent in coming and returning .

text: There was no comfort in having him in London ; he might as well be at Enscombe ; but Richmond was the very distance for easy intercourse . Better than nearer !
text_tokenized: There was no comfort in having him in London ; he might as well be at Enscombe ; but Richmond was the very distance for easy intercourse . Better than nearer !

text: One good thing was immediately brought to a certainty by this removal,-- the ball at the Crown . It had not been forgotten before , but it had been soon acknowledged vain to attempt to fix a day .
text_tokenized: One good thing was immediately brought to a certainty by this removal,-- the ball at the Crown . It had not been forgotten before , but it had been soon acknowledged vain to attempt to fix a day .

text: Now , however , it was absolutely to be ; every preparation was resumed , and very soon after the Churchills had removed to Richmond , a few lines from Frank , to say that his aunt felt already much better for the change , and that he had no doubt of being able to join them for twenty - four hours at any given time , induced them to name as early a day as possible .
text_tokenized: Now , however , it was absolutely to be ; every preparation was resumed , and very soon after the Churchills had removed to Richmond , a few lines from Frank , to say that his aunt felt already much better for the change , and that he had no doubt of being able to join them for twenty - four hours at any given time , induced them to name as early a day as possible .

text: Mr. Weston 's ball was to be a real thing .
text_tokenized: Mr. Weston 's ball was to be a real thing .

text: A very few to - morrows stood between the young people of Highbury and happiness .
text_tokenized: A very few to - morrows stood between the young people of Highbury and happiness .

text: Mr. Woodhouse was resigned .
text_tokenized: Mr. Woodhouse was resigned .

text: The time of year lightened the evil to him .
text_tokenized: The time of year lightened the evil to him .

text: May was better for every thing than February .
text_tokenized: May was better for every thing than February .

text: Mrs. Bates was engaged to spend the evening at Hartfield , James had due notice , and he sanguinely hoped that neither dear little Henry nor dear little John would have any thing the matter with them , while dear Emma were gone .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Bates was engaged to spend the evening at Hartfield , James had due notice , and he sanguinely hoped that neither dear little Henry nor dear little John would have any thing the matter with them , while dear Emma were gone .
